ArcGIS Experience Builder Developers Guide

System requirement

  • Node.js 10.x

For Configuration Users

  • Open the Command Prompt window
  • cd server
  • Run npm ci
  • Run node src/server
  • Register your Experience Builder client on ArcGIS for Developers site. The URL to open Experience Builder https://[domain]:3001/ needs to be one of the Redirect URIs under the Authentication tab.
  • Go to client/dist/builder/setting.json to set the clientId under the prod section.
  • Open https://<domain>:3001 in the browser.

For Developers

  • Open the Command Prompt window
  • cd server
  • Run npm ci. If you encounter error something like can't find Python when run npm ci, please run npm install --global windows-build-tools firstly.
  • Run node src/server
  • cd client
  • Run npm ci
  • Create a widget (theme) under your-extensions/widgets (themes) folder. You can copy one from the sample-widgets folder to quick start.
  • Run npm start
  • Register your Experience Builder client on ArcGIS for Developers site. The URL to open Experience Builder https://[domain]:3001/ needs to be one of the Redirect URIs under the Authentication tab.
  • Go to client/dist/builder/setting.json to set the clientId under the prod section.
  • Open https://<domain>:3001 in the browser.

About https certificate

Experience Builder requires https to access, but there is only a self signed certificate in the release package. So, when you access the server, the browser will complain the server is not secure. In this case, you can choose to trust the certificate, or you can get your own certificate and put it in server/cert folder. If you choose to trust the self signed certificate, you will see these errors in the browser console: An SSL certificate error occurred when fetching the script. and service-worker-registration.js:41 Error during service worker registration: DOMException. These errors means the service worker does not cache the files successfully, but they do not affect Experience Builder functions.
